statement.p: This is a circle with radius 5.00 mm inscribed in a square with no side labeled. Round using the rules for measurements.

ol.li: What is the area of the square? \displaystyle\text{mm}^{{2}}
What is the area of the circle? \displaystyle\text{mm}^{{2}}
What is the area of the shaded section? \displaystyle\text{mm}^{{2}}

solution.p: The side length of the square is not given directly. However, because the circle is inscribed, a diameter of the circle is the same length as a side. Thus the square has side length \displaystyle{10.0}\ \text{ mm} and area \displaystyle{10.0}^{{2}}={100}\approx{100}\ \text{ mm}^{{2}}.
The area of the circle is \displaystyle\pi{\left({5.00}^{{2}}\right)}\approx{78.539816339745}\approx{78.5}\ \text{ mm}^{{2}}.
The area between them (shaded) is \displaystyle{100}-{78.539816339745}={21.460183660255}\approx{21}\ \text{ mm}^{{2}}.
